sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示人的"能力，才能"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: ability, capacity, capability, genius, talent, competence, faculty, gift, aptitude
means: ability ：普通用词，指人先天的或学来的各种能力。
capacity ：侧重指人的潜在能力，通常不指体力，多指才智，尤指接受与领悟能力。
capability ：多用于人，指胜任某项具体工作的能力，也指本身具有、尚未发挥的潜在能力。常与of或for连用。
genius ：语气最强，指天赋的高度才能与智力。
talent ：着重指人某方面具有可发展和倍养的突出天赋才能，但语意比genius弱。
competence ：正式用词，侧重指令人满意的业务能力与水平，达到胜任某项工作等的要求。
gift ：着重个人的天赋的才能或在某方面的显著本领，常暗含不能用一般规律作解释的意味。
aptitude ：多指先天或后天习得的运用自如的能力，常暗示接受能力强，能迅速掌握一种学术训练或艺术技巧。

sentence.Network_en: The country needs a defence capability as insurance against the unexpected.
sentence.Network_cn: 国家需要有一定的防御能力，以应对不可预知的情况。

sentence.Network_en: The European states retained a latent capability to menace Britain's own security.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧洲国家仍具有威胁英国自身安全的潜在能力。

sentence.Network_en: No one ever questioned her capability.
sentence.Network_cn: 从来没有人质疑她的能力。

entry.def: If you have the capability or the capabilities to do something, you have the ability or the qualities that are necessary to do it.

example.ex: People experience differences in physical and mental capability depending on the time of day...
example.tran: 在一天当中的不同时间,人的体力和脑力也会有所差异。

example.ex: The standards set four years ago in Seoul will be far below the athletes' capabilities now.
example.tran: 4年前在首尔制定的标准将远远低于目前运动员的水平。

entry.def: A country's military capability is its ability to fight in a war.

example.ex: Their military capability has been reduced because their air force has proved not to be effective...
example.tran: 由于空军战斗力不够强大，他们的军事实力有所下降。

example.ex: They have the capability to destroy the enemy in days rather than weeks.
example.tran: 他们有能力在几天内,而不是几个星期内消灭敌人。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being capable -- physically or intellectually or legally;

sentences.sentence: "he worked to the limits of his capability"

means.word_mean: 2. the susceptibility of something to a particular treatment;

sentences.sentence: "the capability of a metal to be fused"

means.word_mean: 3. an aptitude that may be developed

auth_sentence.content: That is well within the World's industrial capability.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is well within the World's industrial capability.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is well within the World's industrial capability.

auth_sentence.content: They can buy any kind of capability they want.
auth_sentence.res_content: They can buy any kind of capability they want.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They can buy any kind of capability they want.

auth_sentence.content: But it has enough capability to cause more problems.
auth_sentence.res_content: But it has enough capability to cause more problems.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But it has enough capability to cause more problems.

Sentence.sentence: Professor Summers said of the iPhone, after the device and its capabilities were explained to him.
Leadership is the most significant word in today's competitive business environment because it directs the manager of a business to focus inward on their personal capabilities and style.

Society expects—and needs—parents to provide their children with continuity of care, meaning the intensive, intimate care that human beings need to develop their intellectual, emotional and moral capabilities.

sentences.en: beyond the scope of human capability
her capability for making sensible decisions
sentences.cn: 她作出明智决定的能力

sentences.en: Organizing a whole department is beyond his capability.
sentences.cn: 组织整个部门是他能力以外的事。

means.word_mean: 尚未发挥的天资或素质

sentences.en: She has the capability to become a very fine actress.
sentences.cn: 她有潜力成为杰出演员。
